score:
Instructor: Shane Donald 
Class Time and Place: Tuesday 10:10 - noon, Engineering 108.
Required Text: Materials are provided by the instructor 
Office and Office Hours: Humanities Building 416, Minday 4:10 - 5pm, Tue noon to 3pm.
Telephone Number: 2451 7250, ext 5639 
Email: teacherfcu2017@gmail.com 


Conversation 2 is a class designed to give you confidence in using English for communication. The focus in this class is on using English as a tool for communication. Therefore, you cannot memorize information in this class in order to pass an exam. Instead, you will constantly be using English in the class. In class please respect the right of your classmates to express their opinions and to be heard. Part of conversation is, after all, being able to listen. I am available during office hours to see students or by appointment. Good luck for the semester ahead. 

Class Rules 
Later than 10 minutes = absent. 
Roll is taken every class 
Absent = -2% of attendance grade 
No food or drink in class (Feng Chia rule) 
A doctor’s note = an excused absence. You are allowed one excused absence per semester 

上課遲到10分鐘以上一律以缺席計。 
事假須於一週前事先告知教師 

Grades 
Impromptu Role-Plays - 30% 
Interviews - 20% 
Reflective Exercise on Interviews  -10%
Spoken assignment - 10% 
Attendance/participation - 30% 

.
Spoken Assignment 
In a group of two or three students will record a dialogue on a topic assigned by the teacher, based on a topic we have covered in class. This is done according to a schedule and done by each group once. After recording your dialogue, email it to me at teacherfcu2017@gmail.com 

Grading for Role Plays 
Length - 25% 
Pronunciation - 25% 
Intonation - 25% 
Interaction - 25% 
These role-plays are impromptu

Final Interviews 
The final exam is an interview with a partner in my office. This is a one-on-one interview. The topic will not be pre-announced, but it will be something we have done in class.
Reflective Exercise - one week after the interview groups will return to my office and watch the video of their interview, reflecitng on what areas need to be improved and which areas were done well.
note: 修習資格及選課方式同上。

score: 期中考撰寫「我的生涯規劃」報告，作為評量人生態度；期末考撰寫「情緒管理與心得」報告，作為評量學習結果。
note: 是否列入畢業學分請至各系確認。詳情  請參閱「通識課程選課須知」。

score:
1、小組討論與成果發表／討論紀錄單：30%。補交以隔週內為限，成績以8折計。
2、個人學習單（含閱讀心得）：60%。補交以隔週內為限，成績以8折計。
3、學習素養：10%（包括出席缺曠、上課態度、小組互評、社會參與）
學習素養依比例計分，學習態度與小組互評另加減總分，全班原則一致。
⑴稱職小組長：+2分。⑵自主參與環運社運活動：+3分。⑶ 優評：+4~6分。⑷負評：-2~6分
⑸1次缺曠-1分。2次缺曠-2分。（含）３次以上缺曠課：-2分／次。6次以上缺曠課，總成績不及格。
⑹上課第一週師生共議課室公約：公私分際+就事論事+學術倫理。第二週為緩衝期，僅勸導，同學可提意見共議。
第三週起違反者依公約處理，學習態度-2分／次，概無異議，以共同維護學習環境與課堂秩序。 
4、部分成績（20%）可改以「環境影像圖文報導」補救（依主題現勘，自拍照片10張以上+訪談2人以上紀錄，串連說明，與教學對話。主題選擇可從參考書目中了解問題脈絡，必須依格式完成。）環境影像圖文報導題目舉例：空污中台灣、許厝分校遷校爭議、中科四期相思寮、大林蒲遷村、美麗灣美麗嗎…等。
note: 是否列入畢業學分請至各系確認。詳情  請參閱「通識課程選課須知」。

score:
Attendance (15 % )

Class participation/ written notes (15%)

Final Group Presentation (35%):
Twenty minute presentation focuses on a specific music-culture, its history, music activities, repertoire, and
instruments. Musical examples and analysis should be provided in the presentation. The topic needs to be
determined and approved by the instructor by the eighth week of the academic semester.

Final Reflection Paper (35%):
Five-page reflection paper which summarizes the group presentation topic with your own thoughts
and what you have learned from the research process. The last page should focus on your own
reflection on what you have taken away from this course.

score:
1. 學期成績計算項目及權重標準如下： 
A. 期中考 40% 
B. 期末考(專題報告) 30% 
C. 平時成績（書面報告、小考、出席狀況） 30% 
2. 考試： 
期中考配合學校考試時程，期末考採專題實作方式實施。內容包含所有講授內容與參考書中部分教材。小考共二次，目的在培養學生平時複習的學習習慣。小考時間均已彈性排定在課程進度表中。 
3. 專題報告及討論： 
學期中有一次個案實作暨討論。微觀本課程詳細課程內容與目標，強調社會議題「凡事總有更好的處理方法-品質管制!，此乃人類發明的最大動力之一，也是促進人類文明的推手」，本課程導入「品質管理模式」、「心智圖」系統化模式帶領學生來瞭解遠古人類在系統上的科學發明。基本上將系統分析上之缺失及品質管理改善方法，以分組方式進行，由3至4人為一組進行。目的在於協助學生經由專題實作及研討活動之中，瞭解系統建構過程之應用。期末專題報告題目由各組（組員）腦力激盪及教師共同產出，格式及撰寫細節在學期中公布，團隊合作及學習過程將是學習評估的重點。期末專題報告小組討論過程及紀錄需確實保留作為成績評核參考，除書面報告外，將安排正式口頭發表。
note: 「兵器系統概論」課程名稱自102學年度第2學期起異動為「系統品質建模與挑戰」，此二科目（為同一科目）重複修習只採計二學分。

一、目的
1、促使學習者探索和覺察個人自我性別角色形塑
2、透過校園性別教育與服務-學習方案，培養學生關懷和包容多元性別議題
3、增能個人性別意識，展演公平正義的性別友善校園
二、參考書目如後
三、個人作業
（一）作業一：我的性/性別脈絡史
主題	:我的性/性別脈絡史、我的母親/父親
個人作業800-900字，紙本以整組方式交給老師，個人作業放置於各組ilearn討論區
1、從家庭、學校教師態度、教材、教學、同儕關係、口語、宗教、大眾媒體等層面，觀察自己在小學、國中、高中、大學不同成長階段，看到自己對性/
性別的刻板印象、性別迷思、性別盲、傳統社會性別結構影響，對議題的描述和反思
2、自己覺察到母親/父親對上述描述的看法，他們的觀點對你的影響

（二）作業二：服務學習日誌一  上課時完成

Now What：你觀察到上述與性別議題時，反思與性別有關事有關的議題
So What：經由反思對性別議題新的啟發

四、團隊作業

（二）作業二：方案設計
參與方案設計、建立共同目標
依服務對象需求，設計性別教育方案與執行

方案設計可以運用影片、辯論
、角色扮演、Q&A、滿意度評量方法等，與服務對象互動

（四）作業四：性別教育與服務-學習方案期中各組反思討論
反思性別意識
團隊困境
方案PPT初稿
方案PPT紙本交給老師，各組15分鐘

score:
藉由本課程的修習，使學生全盤了解衛星定位導航之理論基礎與運作流程，透過課堂講授與專題報告練習，了解與掌握衛星定位系統運作的理論、原理、方法、與應用。課程內容將介紹衛星導航系統的工作原理，包含地理資訊系統概論(Geographic Information Systems; GIS)、衛星定位導航系統介紹(Global Navigation Satellite System; GNSS)、美國衛星定位系統運作原理(Global Positioning System; GPS)、電子地圖製作方法、坐標系統介紹、路徑規劃演算法等。
1.期中考試及隨堂課業：
    期中考試採隨堂測驗方式，於學校正式期中考結束後次週舉行。內容包括上課講授內容與教科書內容。隨堂課業包含平時測驗、作業、及課程中之口頭問答等，目的在於培養學生平日良好的學習態度及學習精神。
2.期末專題報告：
　　期末專題報告為本課程最重要的學習活動之一，主要以「衛星定位導航相關創新延伸應用」為主題，採分組方式由學生發揮創意與想像力，共同討論研究，展現團隊合作能力，提出創新的衛星定位系統相關應用。每一專題由二至三人為一組進行之，須完成專題企劃書(Word)及簡報(PowerPoint)資料，並於期末安排進行口頭簡報，說明創新應用的構想與內容。專題報告著重在對衛星定位導航應用的瞭解與領悟，並藉由與其它資訊科學的整合應用，運用豐富的想像力，活用衛星定位導航應用，並培養同學的創新能力。
　　學期成績計算項目及權重標準如下：
1.期中考試：25%
2.隨堂課業(含隨堂測驗、作業、口頭問答等)：35%
3.期末專題報告：40%

score:
本課程探討視覺藝術的各個層面, 包括視覺藝術與回應屬於藝術本質的內容認知、與價值分析。研究內容涉及藝術和美感分析, 並與心理、哲學、藝術治療領域連結, 藉此來了解各種視覺藝術創作的心理與內涵。從「美的歷程」探索心靈，討論藝術圖像的象徵性和超越的功能，使學生對視覺藝術創作的評析延伸深化至個人對創造力的認識，透過了解視覺藝術與創作的內涵、背景、定義、 範疇和特性，進而學習如何釋放自己的創意潛能。

cname: 社會學習參與專題:新移民互動平台
score:
1.	十次課堂點名，每次佔學期總成績兩分(遲到或早退則扣一分)。總計佔學期總成績20%。

2.	田野實作作業一份。請同學自行安排時間，訪問在中部地區積極參與公眾事務、或是經營事業有成的新住民，或是參訪與新住民相關之社會團體。訪問或參訪過後，請以臉書、IG、微博、PTT、Dcard或Blogger等任何一種網路自媒體(self-media)的形式發布(PO文)，其中應該包含與訪問對象的合照，或是在參訪地點學生本人有入鏡的照片兩張以上。如果是文字形式的心得感想，應介於200到1000字之間；如果是影片，應為兩分鐘到十分鐘之間(影片應經過適當剪輯，請勿直接使用直播功能)。同學們可結伴訪問相同的對象、參訪相同的團體，但是必須分別繳交內容不同的作業。完成後請將網址連結傳給授課老師。本項作業請於5月31日之前完成。本次田野作業佔期末總成績20%。以下為建議之參訪對象或團體：

•	林麗蟬(柬埔寨裔新住民)：立法委員、台灣新移民發展與交流協會理事長
•	麥玉珍(越南裔新住民)：社團法人台灣新移民協會秘書長
•	鄭尤莉(印尼裔新住民)：苗栗縣VIP(Vietnam Indonesia Philippines)姊妹協會理事長
•	武橋興(越南裔新住民)：彰化師大駐越南教育推廣中心執行長
•	陳妍蓁(印尼裔新住民)：1095文史工作室志工兼印尼語講師
•	楊美英(泰國裔新住民)：東協廣場三樓轉角泰國餐廳負責人
•	裴子晴(越南裔新住民)：台中市Hello Vietnam河內美食連鎖餐廳負責人

3.	期末報告一篇，由同學自選與新住民、新二代或移工相關的題目，並於第九周上課結束後，向授課教師繳交期末報告題目(不計分)。於六月的第一周與第二周，同學上台做口頭報告，佔學期總成績20%。於課程最後一周(06/26)的上課前，將報告的電子檔(PPT、Word、PDF或是影片格式)上傳至逢甲教學網，佔學期總成績20%。

4.	上課前請先預讀三到四篇之指定教材(指定教材皆列於課程大綱內)，以利於上課討論。上課踴躍發言討論，或是回答老師問題者，每次加一到兩分不等(授課教師可能以口頭詢問或是Line訊息的方式提出問題，所以第一堂課請同學們先加入老師的Line群組)。佔學期總成績20%。

score:
1.第一至第八週：體適能檢測二週(坐姿體前彎、仰臥起坐、立定跳遠、800/1,600m跑走)。陸上運動課程─依教師專長項目協同教學，每專項單元授課二至三週，循序轉換。
2.第九週起：游泳課程─同時段依學生游泳能力進行分級分組協同教學。　 
3.體適能檢測不合格者需參加體適能補救教學，無故未參加者體育成績不及格。
4.無故缺課(含服裝不整)三次者體育術科扣考。
note: 上課地點:游泳池,天冷至校外上課須另付費

score:
Instructor: Shane Donald 
Class Time and Place: Engineering Building 302, Wednesday 8:10 - 10am
Required Text: 
Office and Office Hours: Humanities Building 416. Monday 4:10 - 5, Tuesday noon to 3pm.
Telephone Number: 2451 7250, ext 5639 
Email:theteachingproject2017@gmail.com

First-year English (FE) is a required 2-credit course for freshman students at Feng Chia University. Split into four levels based upon students’ English proficiency, it aims to develop their communication skills. Homework assignments emphasize reading. The reading should help students simultaneously improve their English and their ability to become autonomous learners. FE’s learning goals are grounded in outcome-based learning practices; this means students should be able to accomplish specific tasks in English, as outlined below, by the end of the course.
FE3 is a three-skills course, focusing on the reading, listening and speaking skills needed in an academic setting. The classroom is an interactive environment where students must communicate with both the teacher and each other. Readings based on academic and multicultural themes will form the core of the English-input materials used. Basic presentation skills will be taught. Students will demonstrate their comprehension and analytical skills through their presentations of a multicultural theme. 




Class Rules 
Later than 10 minutes = absent. 
Roll is taken every class 
Absent = -2% of attendance grade 
No food or drink in class (Feng Chia rule) 
A doctor’s note = an excused absence. You are allowed one excused absence per semester 

上課遲到10分鐘以上一律以缺席計。 
事假須於一週前事先告知教師

平時Course work 60%
(1) Communicative Task(s) (role play/presenation/videos/posters): 10% minimum (with culture elements tied to outside reading materials)
(2) Outside Reading (one reading related to Multiculturalism assessed by the Communicative Task as above): homework, quizzes (10% minimum)
(3) added by levels
期中Midterm exam 20%
Exam papers + outside reading (10%) : unified by levels
期末Final exam 20%
Exam papers + outside reading (10%): unified by levels

Grades
Midterm exam  - 20%
Final exam - 20%
Extensive reading (10 graded readers) - 20%
Short film self-introduction - 10%
Participation - 20% (two participation sheets)
Presentations - 10%
note: 高級班(第4級)。

cname: 資訊素養作業五：自我介紹檔案
score:
In order to be considered for the contest, and to get a grade of 61% - 100% on your video in Freshman English, your video must be:
~handed in by April 21 (with all troubleshooting done by May 15)
~include an anecdotal story showing one of your character traits
~not violate copyright

Feedback, due dates, and the chance to troubleshoot:
If you hand it in between April 22 - April 30, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it has not passed, read your feedback and fix your video. You have until May 15 to troubleshoot so that you get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English.

Too late to troubleshoot:
If you do not hand in your video at all until May 1~May 15, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it includes an anecdote about a character trait and does not have any copyright issues, you will get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English. However, if your video fails, you will not be given the opportunity to correct technical problems or missing content this year. You will get a FAIL in Information Literacy, and a failing grade on this assignment in Freshman English as well. Hopefully, the feedback will help you fix up your video to hand it in again next year.

Minimum Requirements:
The minimal requirements in order to PASS this project in Information Literacy and get 60% in Freshman English, are these. You must hand in your video by May 15, it must include an anecdotal story about one of your character traits, and it must not have any copyright issues. This is the FINAL DUE DATE. No updates will be accepted beyond this date.

Add YouTube link to Learning Portfolio:
Post your YouTube video link in your Learning Portfolio to make your grade official. Get someone studying the same Major as you to log in to iLearn, view your Learning Portfolio, and try to play your video. If they can, I should be able to too. If they cannot, you have done something wrong, and I won't be able to see it either. Learning Portfolios without a working link to the YouTube video will lose marks.

score:
Instructor: Shane Donald 
Class Time and Place: Engineering Building 302, Wednesday 8:10 - 10am
Required Text: 
Office and Office Hours: Humanities Building 416. Monday 4:10 - 5, Tuesday noon to 3pm.
Telephone Number: 2451 7250, ext 5639 
Email:theteachingproject2017@gmail.com

First-year English (FE) is a required 2-credit course for freshman students at Feng Chia University. Split into four levels based upon students’ English proficiency, it aims to develop their communication skills. Homework assignments emphasize reading. The reading should help students simultaneously improve their English and their ability to become autonomous learners. FE’s learning goals are grounded in outcome-based learning practices; this means students should be able to accomplish specific tasks in English, as outlined below, by the end of the course.
FE3 is a three-skills course, focusing on the reading, listening and speaking skills needed in an academic setting. The classroom is an interactive environment where students must communicate with both the teacher and each other. Readings based on academic and multicultural themes will form the core of the English-input materials used. Basic presentation skills will be taught. Students will demonstrate their comprehension and analytical skills through their presentations of a multicultural theme. 




Class Rules 
Later than 10 minutes = absent. 
Roll is taken every class 
Absent = -2% of attendance grade 
No food or drink in class (Feng Chia rule) 
A doctor’s note = an excused absence. You are allowed one excused absence per semester 

上課遲到10分鐘以上一律以缺席計。 
事假須於一週前事先告知教師

平時Course work 60%
(1) Communicative Task(s) (role play/presenation/videos/posters): 10% minimum (with culture elements tied to outside reading materials)
(2) Outside Reading (one reading related to Multiculturalism assessed by the Communicative Task as above): homework, quizzes (10% minimum)
(3) added by levels
期中Midterm exam 20%
Exam papers + outside reading (10%) : unified by levels
期末Final exam 20%
Exam papers + outside reading (10%): unified by levels

Grades
Midterm exam  - 20%
Final exam - 20%
Extensive reading (10 graded readers) - 20%
Short film self-introduction - 10%
Participation - 20% (two participation sheets)
Presentations - 10%

score:
In order to be considered for the contest, and to get a grade of 61% - 100% on your video in Freshman English, your video must be:
~handed in by April 21 (with all troubleshooting done by May 15)
~include an anecdotal story showing one of your character traits
~not violate copyright

Feedback, due dates, and the chance to troubleshoot:
If you hand it in between April 22 - April 30, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it has not passed, read your feedback and fix your video. You have until May 15 to troubleshoot so that you get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English.

Too late to troubleshoot:
If you do not hand in your video at all until May 1~May 15, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it includes an anecdote about a character trait and does not have any copyright issues, you will get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English. However, if your video fails, you will not be given the opportunity to correct technical problems or missing content this year. You will get a FAIL in Information Literacy, and a failing grade on this assignment in Freshman English as well. Hopefully, the feedback will help you fix up your video to hand it in again next year.

Minimum Requirements:
The minimal requirements in order to PASS this project in Information Literacy and get 60% in Freshman English, are these. You must hand in your video by May 15, it must include an anecdotal story about one of your character traits, and it must not have any copyright issues. This is the FINAL DUE DATE. No updates will be accepted beyond this date.

Add YouTube link to Learning Portfolio:
Post your YouTube video link in your Learning Portfolio to make your grade official. Get someone studying the same Major as you to log in to iLearn, view your Learning Portfolio, and try to play your video. If they can, I should be able to too. If they cannot, you have done something wrong, and I won't be able to see it either. Learning Portfolios without a working link to the YouTube video will lose marks.

score:
In order to be considered for the contest, and to get a grade of 61% - 100% on your video in Freshman English, your video must be:
~handed in by April 21 (with all troubleshooting done by May 15)
~include an anecdotal story showing one of your character traits
~not violate copyright

Feedback, due dates, and the chance to troubleshoot:
If you hand it in between April 22 - April 30, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it has not passed, read your feedback and fix your video. You have until May 15 to troubleshoot so that you get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English.

Too late to troubleshoot:
If you do not hand in your video at all until May 1~May 15, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it includes an anecdote about a character trait and does not have any copyright issues, you will get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English. However, if your video fails, you will not be given the opportunity to correct technical problems or missing content this year. You will get a FAIL in Information Literacy, and a failing grade on this assignment in Freshman English as well. Hopefully, the feedback will help you fix up your video to hand it in again next year.

Minimum Requirements:
The minimal requirements in order to PASS this project in Information Literacy and get 60% in Freshman English, are these. You must hand in your video by May 15, it must include an anecdotal story about one of your character traits, and it must not have any copyright issues. This is the FINAL DUE DATE. No updates will be accepted beyond this date.

Add YouTube link to Learning Portfolio:
Post your YouTube video link in your Learning Portfolio to make your grade official. Get someone studying the same Major as you to log in to iLearn, view your Learning Portfolio, and try to play your video. If they can, I should be able to too. If they cannot, you have done something wrong, and I won't be able to see it either. Learning Portfolios without a working link to the YouTube video will lose marks.

score:
Instructor: Shane Donald 
Class Time and Place: Engineering Building 302, Wednesday 8:10 - 10am
Required Text: 
Office and Office Hours: Humanities Building 416. Monday 4:10 - 5, Tuesday noon to 3pm.
Telephone Number: 2451 7250, ext 5639 
Email:theteachingproject2017@gmail.com

First-year English (FE) is a required 2-credit course for freshman students at Feng Chia University. Split into four levels based upon students’ English proficiency, it aims to develop their communication skills. Homework assignments emphasize reading. The reading should help students simultaneously improve their English and their ability to become autonomous learners. FE’s learning goals are grounded in outcome-based learning practices; this means students should be able to accomplish specific tasks in English, as outlined below, by the end of the course.
FE3 is a three-skills course, focusing on the reading, listening and speaking skills needed in an academic setting. The classroom is an interactive environment where students must communicate with both the teacher and each other. Readings based on academic and multicultural themes will form the core of the English-input materials used. Basic presentation skills will be taught. Students will demonstrate their comprehension and analytical skills through their presentations of a multicultural theme. 




Class Rules 
Later than 10 minutes = absent. 
Roll is taken every class 
Absent = -2% of attendance grade 
No food or drink in class (Feng Chia rule) 
A doctor’s note = an excused absence. You are allowed one excused absence per semester 

上課遲到10分鐘以上一律以缺席計。 
事假須於一週前事先告知教師

平時Course work 60%
(1) Communicative Task(s) (role play/presenation/videos/posters): 10% minimum (with culture elements tied to outside reading materials)
(2) Outside Reading (one reading related to Multiculturalism assessed by the Communicative Task as above): homework, quizzes (10% minimum)
(3) added by levels
期中Midterm exam 20%
Exam papers + outside reading (10%) : unified by levels
期末Final exam 20%
Exam papers + outside reading (10%): unified by levels

Grades
Midterm exam  - 20%
Final exam - 20%
Extensive reading (10 graded readers) - 20%
Short film self-introduction - 10%
Participation - 20% (two participation sheets)
Presentations - 10%
note: 高級班(第4級)。

You must hand in your video by May 15, it must include an anecdotal story about one of your character traits, and it must not have any copyright issues. This is the FINAL DUE DATE. No updates will be accepted beyond this date.

Add YouTube link to Learning Portfolio:
Post your YouTube video link in your Learning Portfolio to make your grade official. Get someone studying the same Major as you to log in to iLearn, view your Learning Portfolio, and try to play your video. If they can, I should be able to too. If they cannot, you have done something wrong, and I won't be able to see it either. Learning Portfolios without a working link to the YouTube video will lose marks.

score:
Instructor: Shane Donald 
Class Time and Place: Engineering Building 302, Wednesday 8:10 - 10am
Required Text: 
Office and Office Hours: Humanities Building 416. Monday 4:10 - 5, Tuesday noon to 3pm.
Telephone Number: 2451 7250, ext 5639 
Email:theteachingproject2017@gmail.com

First-year English (FE) is a required 2-credit course for freshman students at Feng Chia University. Split into four levels based upon students’ English proficiency, it aims to develop their communication skills. Homework assignments emphasize reading. The reading should help students simultaneously improve their English and their ability to become autonomous learners. FE’s learning goals are grounded in outcome-based learning practices; this means students should be able to accomplish specific tasks in English, as outlined below, by the end of the course.
FE3 is a three-skills course, focusing on the reading, listening and speaking skills needed in an academic setting. The classroom is an interactive environment where students must communicate with both the teacher and each other. Readings based on academic and multicultural themes will form the core of the English-input materials used. Basic presentation skills will be taught. Students will demonstrate their comprehension and analytical skills through their presentations of a multicultural theme. 




Class Rules 
Later than 10 minutes = absent. 
Roll is taken every class 
Absent = -2% of attendance grade 
No food or drink in class (Feng Chia rule) 
A doctor’s note = an excused absence. You are allowed one excused absence per semester 

上課遲到10分鐘以上一律以缺席計。 
事假須於一週前事先告知教師

平時Course work 60%
(1) Communicative Task(s) (role play/presenation/videos/posters): 10% minimum (with culture elements tied to outside reading materials)
(2) Outside Reading (one reading related to Multiculturalism assessed by the Communicative Task as above): homework, quizzes (10% minimum)
(3) added by levels
期中Midterm exam 20%
Exam papers + outside reading (10%) : unified by levels
期末Final exam 20%
Exam papers + outside reading (10%): unified by levels

Grades
Midterm exam  - 20%
Final exam - 20%
Extensive reading (10 graded readers) - 20%
Short film self-introduction - 10%
Participation - 20% (two participation sheets)
Presentations - 10%
note: 高級班(第4級)。

score:
In order to be considered for the contest, and to get a grade of 61% - 100% on your video in Freshman English, your video must be:
~handed in by April 21 (with all troubleshooting done by May 15)
~include an anecdotal story showing one of your character traits
~not violate copyright

Feedback, due dates, and the chance to troubleshoot:
If you hand it in between April 22 - April 30, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it has not passed, read your feedback and fix your video. You have until May 15 to troubleshoot so that you get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English.

Too late to troubleshoot:
If you do not hand in your video at all until May 1~May 15, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it includes an anecdote about a character trait and does not have any copyright issues, you will get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English. However, if your video fails, you will not be given the opportunity to correct technical problems or missing content this year. You will get a FAIL in Information Literacy, and a failing grade on this assignment in Freshman English as well. Hopefully, the feedback will help you fix up your video to hand it in again next year.

Minimum Requirements:
The minimal requirements in order to PASS this project in Information Literacy and get 60% in Freshman English, are these. You must hand in your video by May 15, it must include an anecdotal story about one of your character traits, and it must not have any copyright issues. This is the FINAL DUE DATE. No updates will be accepted beyond this date.

Add YouTube link to Learning Portfolio:
Post your YouTube video link in your Learning Portfolio to make your grade official. Get someone studying the same Major as you to log in to iLearn, view your Learning Portfolio, and try to play your video. If they can, I should be able to too. If they cannot, you have done something wrong, and I won't be able to see it either. Learning Portfolios without a working link to the YouTube video will lose marks.

cname: 資訊素養作業五：自我介紹檔案
score:
In order to be considered for the contest, and to get a grade of 61% - 100% on your video in Freshman English, your video must be:
~handed in by April 21 (with all troubleshooting done by May 15)
~include an anecdotal story showing one of your character traits
~not violate copyright

Feedback, due dates, and the chance to troubleshoot:
If you hand it in between April 22 - April 30, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it has not passed, read your feedback and fix your video. You have until May 15 to troubleshoot so that you get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English.

Too late to troubleshoot:
If you do not hand in your video at all until May 1~May 15, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it includes an anecdote about a character trait and does not have any copyright issues, you will get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English. However, if your video fails, you will not be given the opportunity to correct technical problems or missing content this year. You will get a FAIL in Information Literacy, and a failing grade on this assignment in Freshman English as well. Hopefully, the feedback will help you fix up your video to hand it in again next year.

Minimum Requirements:
The minimal requirements in order to PASS this project in Information Literacy and get 60% in Freshman English, are these. You must hand in your video by May 15, it must include an anecdotal story about one of your character traits, and it must not have any copyright issues. This is the FINAL DUE DATE. No updates will be accepted beyond this date.

Add YouTube link to Learning Portfolio:
Post your YouTube video link in your Learning Portfolio to make your grade official. Get someone studying the same Major as you to log in to iLearn, view your Learning Portfolio, and try to play your video. If they can, I should be able to too. If they cannot, you have done something wrong, and I won't be able to see it either. Learning Portfolios without a working link to the YouTube video will lose marks.

score:
Course objectives 
By taking this course, students will be able to: 
1.	Identify topics of readings and predict their content.
2.	Skim for gist, and scan for relevant details.  
3.	Examine multicultural differences mentioned in readings and give an oral presentation. 

My office hours are Monday 4 - 5pm, Tuesday 12 - 3pm.
My office is Ren Shi 416.
I can be contacted by email at theteachingproject2017@gmail.com

Grades
Oral presentations - 20%
Midterm exam  - 20%
Final exam - 20%
Participation - 20%
Extensive reading - 20% (10 graded readers)

Class rule - smartphones stay in the bag unless used for a pedagoical task.




Class Rules 
Later than 10 minutes = absent. 
Roll is taken every class 
Absent = -2% of attendance grade 
No food or drink in class (Feng Chia rule) 
A doctor’s note = an excused absence. You are allowed one excused absence per semester 

上課遲到10分鐘以上一律以缺席計。 
事假須於一週前事先告知教師
note: 中高級班(第3級)。
高級班(第4級)。

~not violate copyright

Feedback, due dates, and the chance to troubleshoot:
If you hand it in between April 22 - April 30, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it has not passed, read your feedback and fix your video. You have until May 15 to troubleshoot so that you get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English.

Too late to troubleshoot:
If you do not hand in your video at all until May 1~May 15, you will get a PASS/FAIL grade, and you will get feedback on your video. If it includes an anecdote about a character trait and does not have any copyright issues, you will get a PASS in Information Literacy and 6/10 in Freshman English. However, if your video fails, you will not be given the opportunity to correct technical problems or missing content this year. You will get a FAIL in Information Literacy, and a failing grade on this assignment in Freshman English as well. Hopefully, the feedback will help you fix up your video to hand it in again next year.

Minimum Requirements:
The minimal requirements in order to PASS this project in Information Literacy and get 60% in Freshman English, are these. You must hand in your video by May 15, it must include an anecdotal story about one of your character traits, and it must not have any copyright issues. This is the FINAL DUE DATE. No updates will be accepted beyond this date.

Add YouTube link to Learning Portfolio:
Post your YouTube video link in your Learning Portfolio to make your grade official. Get someone studying the same Major as you to log in to iLearn, view your Learning Portfolio, and try to play your video. If they can, I should be able to too. If they cannot, you have done something wrong, and I won't be able to see it either. Learning Portfolios without a working link to the YouTube video will lose marks.

※個人寫作作業：尋味故鄉

（1）寫作主題：尋味故鄉（10%）
（2）繳交日期：3月29日23:59前上傳至iLearn。
（3）字數：600-1000字
（4）個人作業繳交格式：PDF檔

	人生最初的記憶，是從襁褓的味道開始。
	年歲漸長，記憶中的味道日漸豐滿，有故鄉泥土的氣味，有家常飯菜的香味，有街頭攤販的美味……。無論走到哪裡，或身在何處，都能靠著這一抹記憶中的味道，讓疲憊的身軀渴望回家，尋找那記憶深處的氣味，尋找那久違的熟悉感。
	幼時那股溫暖內心的氣味，總會深藏在我們的記憶深處，因為記憶中的味道是人們賴以對抗庸碌生活的勇氣，每當被日子糟蹋得疲憊了，那故鄉的味道便會喚醒心底的記憶──但這樣還不夠，記憶中有太多的味道，等待著我們一一細數。故鄉空氣中泥土的氣味，可能是兒時奔跑田野的快樂記憶；故鄉老屋裡食物的香味，是家人為自己烹煮菜餚的甜蜜時光；故鄉街道裡攤販的叫賣聲，存著兒時撒嬌耍賴的回憶……
	所以讓我們共同尋找成長過程中，指引回家的那股味道。它可以是土地、房屋、親人的氣味，也可以是舌尖上的味道，讓這些許多的記憶浮現在腦海裡，進一步呈現最能想起故鄉一切的味道。


※團體報告：報逢甲
（1）「報逢甲」：報導文學(逢甲人物故事採訪報導)，每篇約3000字。20%
（2）搭配107-1 第二屆「與時間拔河」徵文比賽活動，及資訊素養作業六：電子書編寫
（3）繳交日期：5月24日23:59前上傳至iLearn
（4）團體作業繳交格式：WORD檔
（5）寫作題材：以廣義之逢甲人為範疇，包含校友、教師、社團、職員、工友等。不含逢甲周圍之商家。
（6）中文寫作，每篇約3000字，至少附照片三張
（7）以Ａ4WORD格式編排，直式橫書12號細明字體繕打，照片畫素品質需為1024x682以上解析度。
（8）題目自訂，惟不可用「報逢甲」。 


	故事，需要說出來，才能被看見。
    逢甲，五十多年的歷史，那麼多的故事，需要從記憶裡挖出來，透過報導，浮出時間的水面。
    一份報導，不只是訊息的流通而已，也承擔起團體的凝結、理念的寄託、敘述力的鍛鍊等功能。首先希望同學能關注日常的環境與人事，期許同學在抬頭展望未來、或低頭緊盯手機之餘，還能環視生活的周遭。其次，在鍛鍊同學的文字報導、圖片拍攝、版面編輯的能力之餘，也與校園的認同感相結合。逢甲，五十餘年了，篳路藍縷一路走來，校園環境的變化、前輩矗立的身影，透過題材的探勘，希望能從空間的層面，一舉拉出時間的縱深、情感的連結，讓在校生與校友共同舉起拔河的繩子，立定腳跟，把世界朝我們的方向拔。

1. 五次上課點名，每次佔學期總成績四分(遲到或早退則扣兩分)。總計佔學期總成績20%。
2. 觀看公民參與相關影片的個人心得報告一份，佔學期總成績20%。
3. 於規定時間內完成分組任務並上繳組員名單(包含組員特性)，佔學期總成績10%。
4. 於規定時間內繳交期末團體報告題目，佔學期總成績10%。
5. 團體口頭報告，佔學期總成績20%。
6. 團體報告電子檔，佔學期總成績20%。
7. 上課發言或主動回答老師的問題，每次加1分，沒有上限。

為避免單向教學的單一視野下所造成的獨斷與狹隘的觀念，本課程透過來自不同學系背景修課同學，以小組共同報告為主，發揮其系所專業與個人專長，從不同主題的資料收集與對話中，習得涵納他人意見的包容力，並取得適度表達個人論點之平衡點。
（一）	課堂講授：建議涵蓋所列課程內容結構之大項。
（二）	學生共同討論與報告
（三）	活動參與：每班每學期參與「通識沙龍」一場的演講為原則。
（四）	參訪或觀看影片：以實地參訪台中地區之各種博物館或相關文物資料中心，或教師可選擇於課堂上播放相關專題演講影片或博物館、美術館、文明古蹟的影片之觀賞替代。
（五）	成績之構成：「課堂表達（口頭報告）」35%、「資料搜集（書面報告）」35%、「通識沙龍心得」10%，以及「出席或參與討論」20%，共4項。

為避免單向教學的單一視野下所造成的獨斷與狹隘的觀念，本課程透過來自不同學系背景修課同學，以小組共同報告為主，發揮其系所專業與個人專長，從不同主題的資料收集與對話中，習得涵納他人意見的包容力，並取得適度表達個人論點之平衡點。
（一）	課堂講授：建議涵蓋所列課程內容結構之大項。
（二）	學生共同討論與報告
（三）	活動參與：每班每學期參與「通識沙龍」一場的演講為原則。
（四）	參訪或觀看影片：以實地參訪台中地區之各種博物館或相關文物資料中心，或教師可選擇於課堂上播放相關專題演講影片或博物館、美術館、文明古蹟的影片之觀賞替代。
（五）	成績之構成：「課堂表達（口頭報告）」35%、「資料搜集（書面報告）」35%、「通識沙龍心得」10%，以及「出席或參與討論」20%，共4項。

為避免單向教學的單一視野下所造成的獨斷與狹隘的觀念，本課程透過來自不同學系背景修課同學，以小組共同報告為主，發揮其系所專業與個人專長，從不同主題的資料收集與對話中，習得涵納他人意見的包容力，並取得適度表達個人論點之平衡點。
本課程採多元化教學，建議教師採取下列方式。
（一）	課堂講授：建議涵蓋所列課程內容結構之大項。
（二）	學生共同討論與報告
（三）	活動參與：每班每學期參與「通識沙龍」一場的演講為原則。
（四）	參訪或觀看影片：以實地參訪台中地區之各種博物館或相關文物資料中心，或教師可選擇於課堂上播放相關專題演講影片或博物館、美術館、文明古蹟的影片之觀賞替代。
（五）	成績之構成：應至少包含「課堂表達（口頭報告）」60%、「通識沙龍心得」20%，以及「出席或參與討論」20%，共3項。

為避免單向教學的單一視野下所造成的獨斷與狹隘的觀念，本課程透過來自不同學系背景修課同學，以小組共同報告為主，發揮其系所專業與個人專長，從不同主題的資料收集與對話中，習得涵納他人意見的包容力，並取得適度表達個人論點之平衡點。

（三）	活動參與：每班每學期參與「通識沙龍」一場的演講為原則。

（一）	課堂講授：建議涵蓋所列課程內容結構之大項。

（三）	活動參與：每班每學期參與「通識沙龍」一場的演講為原則。
（四）	參訪或觀看影片：以實地參訪台中地區之各種博物館或相關文物資料中心，或教師可選擇於課堂上播放相關專題演講影片或博物館、美術館、文明古蹟的影片之觀賞替代。
（五）	成績之構成：「課堂表達（口頭報告）」35%、「資料搜集（書面報告）」35%、「通識沙龍心得」10%，以及「出席或參與討論」20%，共4項。

1. 五次上課點名，每次佔學期總成績四分(遲到或早退則扣兩分)。總計佔學期總成績20%。
2. 參訪與聽完演講後之個人心得報告各一份，兩份佔學期總成績20%。
3. 於規定時間內完成分組任務並上繳組員名單，佔學期總成績5%。
4. 於規定時間內繳交期末團體報告題目，佔學期總成績5%。
5. 團體口頭報告，佔學期總成績20%。
6. 團體書面報告(電子檔)，佔學期總成績20%。
7. 上課發言討論，每次可加一分，總計佔學期總成績10%。

1. 五次上課點名，每次佔學期總成績四分(遲到或早退則扣兩分)。總計佔學期總成績20%。
2. 參訪與聽完演講後之個人心得報告一份，佔學期總成績20%。
3. 於規定時間內完成分組任務並上繳組員名單，佔學期總成績5%。
4. 於規定時間內繳交期末團體報告題目，佔學期總成績5%。
5. 團體口頭報告，佔學期總成績20%。
6. 團體報告電子檔，佔學期總成績20%。
7. 上課發言討論(10%)，每次回答問題可加一分，但加分沒有上限。

1.課堂參與動機及討論30%
2.社會實際參與之基本社會調查技巧30%
3.成果發表40%

課程習評量方式之主要目標，為跨領域學生分組團隊合作學習經驗的建立，故此課程以學生為主體之學習活動，教師只扮演引導與協助學生學習與實作練習的角色。
     課程習評量方式著重在學生的合作實際體驗、與成果之發表、及師生知識與經驗的相互回饋。
一、各院系學生平均隨機分組(分組表)。
二、相互認識與設置分組臉書或群組(每人問答表)。
三、分組討論(各組討論表)。
四、分組作業(作業規畫與分工表)。
五、各組組員互評(每人互評表)。
